example[0]: the imperfect world we live in
definition[1]: imperfect goods, products etc have not been made completely correctly
example[1]: Years ago, manufacturers used shopping malls to unload imperfect goods.
definition[2]: used to describe markets or competition where competing products cannot be compared exactly because they are not exactly the same, not everyone has complete information about them etc. Most real markets are imperfect
example[2]: For advocates of market allocation, government is a major source of imperfect competition.
